problems.title: Knight's Tour
problems.description:
Problem Statement

Given a N*N board with the Knight placed on the first block of an empty board. Moving according to the rules of chess knight must visit each square exactly once. Print the order of each cell in which they are visited.

Input: N
Output: N*N grid where cell (i,j) contains the step number (0 to N*N-1).
If multiple solutions exist, print any one. If no solution, print nothing (or handle gracefully, but N=8 always has solution).

Note: For N=8, finding a solution might be slow without Warnsdorff's rule, but N will be small (<=8) or time limit generous.
problems.examples:
Sample Input
5

Sample Output
0 11 16 5 22
17 6 21 10 15
12 1 14 23 4
7 18 3 20 9
2 13 8 19 24

Explanation:
A valid tour on 5x5 board.
hintsList: Start from (0,0). Try all 8 knight moves.
Use Warnsdorff's rule (pick move with fewest onward moves) for efficiency.
